text.tspan: In the story of Fidelion, soldiers, and harriers wear gas masks to protect their
identity from severe consequences or instill fear in their enemies. The color
red is associated with death, blood, and war.
In Fidelia, gas masks symbolize dehumanized,
individuals and regimes or individuals who
dissent from the power structure. Gas masks in
Fidelia evoke dread and the implication of
This two-legged beast is a significant addition to the Fidelian
Empire's arsenal, equipped with a single extended cannon and
two beaming lights on the front. It is powered by an engine
and diesel and is used by the Fidelian Empire in their battles
Under Jake's command, an aide and brilliant engineer
developed even more advanced military technology,
eventually creating a robust and destructive bipedal weapon
In the background of this robust military
Even before the war, Rowan had served as
Jake's right-hand man and is still
considered the best tactician in the
Celine, discovered in a small village,
caught Jake's attention and quickly rose to
prominence in Fidelia despite having no
For years, the Fidelian Empire ruled
using highly trained soldiers to establish
with the support of powerful allies such
as the Kossacks and Hunters, Jake
Marcus' regime was unstoppable, and no
The Fidelian army is well-trained and prepared to face any threat. However, the general public's understanding of
the Fidelian military is limited to what they have been taught. In addition, the Fidelian army has its own unique
culture, language, and military practices. Therefore, it may seem overwhelming, strict, and intimidating to those
with little or no military culture exposure.
Fidelion is organized as a vertical society, with social
status determined by one's position on the ladder. It
serves as a fort and an oil drilling device, standing at the
center of Fidelia and supported by three pillars. It
continuously extracts oil, considered as valuable as gold
by Jake Marcus and everyone else.
Jake's room is located in the middle and top of Fidelion,
respectively, and Jake can oversee the city and its people
from his balcony. From this vantage point, he makes
announcements, lives extravagantly, and wields control
To achieve this, he began raiding surrounding villages and forcing them to
join his army and work for him. Although people noticed his greed had
become excessive, they still followed him due to his effective leadership.
Over time, Jake began to treat the villages as colonies, attacking and
annexing them, forcing the men to become enslaved people and soldiers and
the women and children to become workers and enslaved people.
The oil city of Texas that Jake
However, as he grew older, Jake
wanted more and sought to acquire
technology to protect his people and
The workers are depicted in the lower-left corner of the logo, the
pipe that transports the oil is displayed in the middle, and the armies
and soldiers are shown in the right corner. These three bars
represent the support that Fidelion receives.
The central part of the logo
represents the heart of Fidelion, an
empire ruled by the upper class.
The upper part of the logo represents the oil
factory, where Fidelia extracts and processes
oil from the ground beneath it.
In Fidelia, there is a strict division
between the upper and lower classes,
with Jake's army working to keep the
lower class in its place and prevent
them from rising. The military uses
this rule to demonstrate its strength
Jake and his followers realized that oil would be a crucial
Jake and his followers realized that oil would be a crucial
resource for the surviving human population. Due to the
powerful EMPs from the nuclear war, all electronic
devices had stopped functioning. As a result, most pre-
war internal combustion engines that relied on electronic
devices could not be used. However, machines with
mechanical control devices preserved knowledge, and
older engines could be installed and used for production.
Ensuring a supply of fuel to run these engines, along with
producing food, became a top priority for the survival of
After a long journey, Jake and his followers established a
new civilization by restarting oil drilling operations.
However, their settlement was disrupted by bandits and
gangsters who threatened and attacked their village,
stealing valuable resources. Determined to bring justice,
Jake led a small group of soldiers in a campaign against
the bandits, using various strategies and motivated by a
desire for revenge. With the support of the villagers, Jake
used all of his strength and abilities to achieve his goals.
One day, a riot broke out due to a shortage of resources. Jake,
who did not intend to cause the riot, played a role in starting
it and became the rebels' leader. He emerged from the bunker
with supplies and weapons, followed by a group of people.

When Jake was five years old, a nuclear war broke out, and he and his parents took refuge in an underground bunker where they lived for 15 years under strict control.
Jake was not the brightest kid of his age before, but through this tragic event of humanity, he lost his smile, childhood, and sense of happiness. From then on, he struggled to understand the meaning of life.
Jake was not the brightest kid of his age before, but through
this tragic event of humanity, he lost his smile, childhood, and
sense of happiness. From then on, he struggled to understand
Jake's distorted thinking manifested in cruel behavior towards insects
and animals. However, he was also intelligent and had a natural talent
for art. He particularly enjoyed listening to Beethoven's only opera,
"Fidelio," which his mother often played for him.
Before the war, Jake Marcus was a typical child from a wealthy family.
He was raised with a privileged perspective and had difficulty
connecting with people outside his social circle. Yet, growing up, he
grappled with questions about justice and struggled to find purpose in
world. The systems that supported society
functioning, and the world was plunged
The survivors struggled to survive in the
aftermath of the war, and 94% of
lucky enough to find shelter in
prepared in advance, but all were
